hanzi-su-wiki:
斎

Значения

Очищение, пост; кабинет

Мнемоника

Быть ровным 斉 (умеренным) во всём, как завещали предки 示. Для этого требуется пост, очищение, а также уединение. Отдельная комната, кабинет.

Варианты

齋, 斋
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhāi
Japanese variant of 斋
Японский вариант 斋
rtega_mnemonic:
齋齋RS
斋斋		斎pious, respectful, chaste, pure, abstain from meat, fast, purify oneself
  • RS. pray for 示 grain 齊/齐
  • ⓢ bearded 而 cultured 文 person in a room: pious
heisig_constituent: purification, sentence, plaid, kilt, Billy Connolly, fenceposts, cabers, altar, show, two, small
heisig_story: Plaid . . . fenceposts . . . altar. This is a "religious" purification, which distinguishes it from the simple kanji for pure (Frame 1659).
Keyword_KANJIDIC: purification, Buddhist food, room, worship, avoid, alike
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: очищение, буддийская еда, комната, поклонение, избегать, так
koohiiStory1: Purification? I think of Japanese during new year's eve praying(saying sentences) in front of Itsukushima's shrine torii(fenceposts) and its altar. They expect to enter the new year totally purified.
koohiiStory2: Kind of vulgar, but here the SCOTSMAN got tired of adjusting himself so decided try PURIFICATION. Sadly, he did it by straddling the ALTAR with his skinny LEGS.
kunYomi: とき、つつし.む、ものいみ、い.む、いわ.う、いつ.く
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Use simultaneous jackhammers to perform the purification ritual. Two jackhammers running perfectly in sync will purify your body, mind, and soul! (And the ground around you that's being jackhammered.)
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Close your eyes and feel the purification begin. Try not to let the loud jackhammering sound bother you, just focus on the simultaneous vibrations cleansing you inside and out.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This purification ritual is supposed to help you forget your cyborg (さい). It's been a while, but you can't seem to get it our of your head.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Hopefully this purification (or just the two jackhammers shaking your brain up like pudding) will get the memories of your cyborg to go away. You can't keep picturing it all the time like this.
Ru_Meaning: purification, Buddhist food, room, worship, avoid, alike
Ru_Notes: Сравни: (斉 ひとしい、セイ、サイ сходство, подобие)
Ru_Words:
斎とき
  • синт. священная пища; принимаемая в храме (прихожанами)
    • 斎いわい
  • празднование, поздравление (чаще お祝い)
    • 斎いみ
  • mourning; abstinence; taboo; religious purification; pure; holy
  • буд. очищение (обряд)
    • 斎戒さいかい
  • очищение, пост, воздержание
    • 書斎しょさい
  • рабочий кабинет
Ru_Radicals: ｜, ノ, 二 (два), 小 (маленький), 廾 (двадцать), 文 (литература), 示 (указывать), 斉 (единообразие)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: equal (斉) to a small (小) purification

Name meaning

zhāi
яп. вм. 斋
Radicals: 斉, 示  (simultaneous, jackhammer)
Meaning Mnemonic
Use simultaneous jackhammers to perform the purification ritual. Two jackhammers running perfectly in sync will purify your body, mind, and soul! (And the ground around you that's being jackhammered.)
Close your eyes and feel the purification begin. Try not to let the loud jackhammering sound bother you, just focus on the simultaneous vibrations cleansing you inside and out.
Reading Mnemonic
This purification ritual is supposed to help you forget your cyborg (さい). It's been a while, but you can't seem to get it our of your head.
Hopefully this purification (or just the two jackhammers shaking your brain up like pudding) will get the memories of your cyborg to go away. You can't keep picturing it all the time like this.
